relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Campus police are seen patrolling the campus and there are saftey phone throughout the campus
TSU is a melting pot of ethnic cultures and that is what makes that campus so great.
The campus clock plays the TSU fight song at noon every day
When students keep their GPA above a 3.0 TSU offers free summer classes
The cafetaria offers a variety of fast food and sandwhich options however if you are a vegetarian the options are limited.

Study at least 3 hours per day for each class in order to be prepared for class and keep up with the syllabus in advance. Professors appreciate the effort and can see who is actually present to do the work.
Keep copies of all items submitted to professors
TSU is an old campus but the faculty is very informative. The cafetaria is clean and the bookstore offers a variety of items to assist with your educational needs.
pageTitle: Tennessee State University (TSU) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {317117=I live in THE ZOO (Mary Wilson Hall), supposedly 2012 has the worst hall ever. The hall itself is wonderful but the females in itare irritating. It's much better being at the guys or honors dorms all day., 371329=I lived in the doors in 2008 when I came in as a Freshman. I was already used to working several hours, so my dorm life was not as much as I know it could have being that I worked and attended school at the same time. I now live off campus and if that is what you decide to do, determination will be your main drive., 380828=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 13951=This school of choice I visited in April on a black college tour with joblink., 370847=Being that I worked in a restaurant, I normally had food from there. Yet, when I did eat on campus, our meals were great and now I understand that meals are healthier than what they were in 2008., 34059=The dorm rooms are not the best at TSU. However, they plan to build a new dorm by the year 2014. Hale, Rudolph and the on campus apartments are the best living spots.}

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Definitely check out the campus and talk to current students and faculty. Come with a open mind. Login to rate or flag the reviews Vicki from Nashville, TN 02/01/2010 Reviewer is Accepted here and planning to attend soon. Reviewer has been to campus. 8 out of 10 people found this review useful. 4 of 92 Categories Comments Great for these types of students A multi-diverse cultural environment campus, with a seemingly serious commitment to gain their degrees, but financially slow. Tips for prospective students Always know what you want to do before making a commmitment to any school, whether it is to go to school to learn, to interact with other peers or to just get away from home, but know for sure what you want beforehand. Bang for the buck Oh indeed, I think that well spent money always can be found in gaining a good education because that money
